sn11.25:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn11.25:4.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
sn11.25:4.5: “Once upon a time, mendicants, Sakka, the Lord of Gods, guiding the gods of the Thirty-three, recited this verse:
sn11.25:5.2: don’t get angry at angry people.
sn11.25:5.4: are always present in the noble ones.
sn11.25:8.1: The Linked Discourses with Sakka are complete.
sn11.25:11.1: The Book With Verses is finished.
